caption: First time going there and it was great. The food and drinks were awesome. Will be coming g back for sure!

Cozy and imitate back garden setup with individually heated, semi-enclosed, covered tables. Lovely food and lovely people. They have table service, but serve everything is in disposable tableware to ensure maximum safety during COVID. Get the fried chicken sandwich or half chicken dish. These people know how to do chicken.

Let me start by saying I’m not a huge fan of take out, BUT... this 👏 place 👏 was 👏 worth it!!! We got the chicken sandwich and the yellowfin tuna. Both were cooked to perfection. The food was so fresh and perfectly balanced. Yes, even their fried chicken tasted light and not overly greasy. Fries were seasoned perfectly and were still palatable despite their trip in the to-go container. We were informed when we went to pick up our dinner that their backyard is open which we plan on visiting in the very near future.

Painfully average during the pandemic. Never been before but my chicken sandwich was worse than chick fil a and my wife’s burger was worse than shake shack. Pretty sad, came here to celebrate something and the food was so ok.
Really nice staff. Really fast service. Food tastes great as well. Cooked, seasoned nicely. Will be back 😊
Tasty, light fare. Lovely shady backyard.
Awesome 🤗
Great experience. Food was excellent.
So good. So intimate and warm. Food is outstanding. Owners are really lovely and attentive. And they do events too!!! Will definitely return.

Just went for Valentine’s Day and the whole experience was spectacular. Would definitely go back. We had oysters (which I wish they would have given us at least 4 each because they were so good) which were seasoned with fresh spices & herbs. We got beer and some cocktails which were quite good. Appetizer was scallops with blood orange, sauces and herbs. Really good! Duck dish & tuna dish were tasty and so well thought out. The chocolate caramel dessert at the end was easily one of the best desserts I have ever had after a meal at a restaurant. I think service, cleanliness, and the atmosphere was superb (Servers were mostly nice and pleasant though could be more receptive to questions after asking us “do you have any questions about the menu?”) Overall, very enjoyable.
Delicious!
Good food, small place so make a reservation ;)
Delicious food. Well thought menu. Delicious cocktails. But WTF... No pheasant on the menu??!!?
I just call this place bird. I mean, a pheasant is a bird, right? So I'm not technically wrong.

The only thing saving this place is the food. The ambiance is unwelcoming. Uncomfortable, crammed tables with hardly any elbow room. The bartender was surly & seemed annoyed by my questions about wine & the hostess refused to seat me until all four of my party were present -- which makes sense but in this instance there were only  two people dining in the place.  There are better restaurants in Greenpoint than this one.

Came here for dinner. We didn’t have a reservation but they were able to seat 2 of us right away on a Saturday night. We’ve been here before and came back because we really liked the food. Our favorite dishes include the crudo, the octopus, and the chicken and rice. The cocktails are pretty good too. The shrimp in garlic and butter was also very tasty.
Best food off if the Graham L stop by far!

Chicken wings here are really good, great as sharing starter option. The pork chop was tasty but needs more sides included, pretty scant. The Euro burger was average, lacking in flavor and the sourdough baps are a terrible idea. Overall pretty overpriced for what u get.

Live down the street, been meaning to go here since it opened.  Great plates for sharing, fried squash w ham was delicious and different.  Oddly the chicken wings were also a highlight!  Everything was good, Sablefish and Shrimp for entree was a good share too.  Great service, will be back!
Nice little place stowed away from the busy BK traffic. Here’s a low down.  The good - Chicken and rice, Burrata, Octopus  The ugly - Euro burger (don’t do it)
This was a great find. We loved everything we ate. The Caesar salad has to be one of the best salads we’ve ever had. Great atmosphere and great service as well!
The food shines in this relaxed space, where the dishes are rich without being heavy, and elevated without being pretentious.
Yummy food and cozy date night spot.

Had the joy of eating at Pheasant with my wife, two kids and mom. We started with the burrata, caesar salad, shrimp and an heirloom tomato salad. All were incredible - the burrata was delicious and we spread it across some toasted artisan bread that came out as well. The plates were cleared completely before we got around to our dinner orders (chicken and rice, pork chops, salmon and some chicken wings). Everything was so good. Flavors were well balanced and solid. It's rare that you find a restaurant where you eat such a wide variety and love everything that comes out but Pheasant delivered 100% on spot. Dessert finished with a Chocolate Pot de Creme. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to anyone. Ambiance was lively but not overly loud out on the patio - perfect for a dinner after a day around the city. Will be back in the future to continue exploring the menu.
Great food, wine list and garden.
Terrific
Delicious food, friendly service, a true locals spot.  We loved the chicken and rice, shrimp, asparagus and polenta. Will definitely be back

(Translated by Google) Much Too loud, too dark, chairs too low, wines much too expensive. May be fine for a drink, a beer ... but not for eating. Very disappointed  (Original) Beaucoup Trop bruyant,  trop sombre, chaises trop basses, vins beaucoup trop cher. Peut être bien pour boire un verre, une bière...,  mais pas pour manger . Très déçu

Cozy place with a few tables and bar seating. Waiter was great at helping us choose and amazing bottle to pair with our food. Everything was delicious and can’t wait to go back and delve further into the menu!
Excellent food

(Translated by Google) Do not miss this address. In a super nice and quiet area 2 steps from the bustle of the City the best table of our stay. We had the chance to taste a lot of dishes and it was perfect.a real treat. The cuisine is inventive light and delicious a real pleasure for the taste buds. An efficient service welcoming and very nice. The locals do not make a mistake there are many regulars. We feel that people enjoy meeting in this place. The chef speaks French we had the chance to chat with him and his cuisine is worth the trip. A beautiful address. Easy by subway. We recommend warmly. L and N B  (Original) Ne ratez pas  cette adresse. Dans un quartier super sympa et tranquille à  2 pas de l'agitation de la City la  meilleure table de notre séjour.  Nous avons eu la chance de goûter à  pas mal de plats et c était  parfait.un vrai régal. La cuisine est inventive légère  et délicieuse un vrai plaisir pour les papilles. Un service efficace acceuillant et très sympa. Les gens du quartier ne s'y trompent pas il y a beaucoup d habitués.  On sent bien que les gens ont plaisir à  se retrouver dans  ce lieu. Le chef parle français nous avons eu la chance de discuter avec lui et sa cuisine vaut le détour. Une bien belle adresse. Facile en métro. On recommande chaudement. L et N B

I love this restaurant I've been twice and will definitely be back a lot more. A great place for a dinner before a show at Brooklyn Steel. Really good drinks and wine recommendations and I've never had anything on the menu I didn't like you really can't go wrong.
Great new neighborhood spot. Had the polenta, burrata, sausage and shrimp - all fantastic. Wine by the glass is a little pricy but tasty.
one of my favorite local places for a nice meal and vin. we’ve had almost everything on the menu and it’s ALL good (though the fish special with castelvetranos is a must try).  all in all, 👍👍.
Amazing food and very friendly service. Definitely would recommend!
Pleasant experience at Pheasant. After a long time i enjoyed a great dinner with my mom & dad.
Absolutely delicious meal. The Fluke was to die for, so fresh and amazing quality ingredients. Definitely check it out!
Great atmosphere and fantastic food! The chicken dish is one of my favorite dishes I've had in a long time - interesting flavors and perfectly cooked.
we had the foccacia, crispy polenta, euro burger, fluke tartare, and fig dessert. all delicious! wine and service also great. def a 5!

Food was remarkable. Every dish was delicious and perfectly executed. Service was great, atmosphere was refreshing, wine selection was excellent.  I hope this restaurant is successful for a long, long time.
We had the broccolini, fried squash and chicken over rice. Fantastic service, and the food is really very impressive. The fitout is cute. This is a good go-to, especially if you’re local.
Good enough you'll want to go every week; affordable enough you might actually be able to
Octopus and Rice were my favorites! The cocktails and atmosphere were amazing. Great spot!
Yuuummmm!! My favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. The food is bonkers, plus the drinks are amazing too. <3
Interesting food in a friendly, trendy space.

I love this place. I’ve taken myself on two impromptu solo dates here and I cannot wait to bring my partner.  Both times I had the cucumber shrimp gazpacho and the burrata with sourdough and tomato jam. Perfect both times. Exactly what I wanted it to be.  It’s a new spot, and it’s a bit off the main drag... so I can see why maybe it isn’t packed yet. But trust me, this quiet hidden gem is worth it. And the have a beautiful backyard garden seating area. Best place on Graham.

Let me just say amazing. The brunch was above and beyond and the aperol spritz are the best ones I have ever had. Totally recommended especially the back garden area. Super laid back and pleasant staff . Loved it

This place is so good! From the amazing cocktails to the food and the most outrageous Caesar salad (try it) I’ve ever had. This place is a serious neighborhood gem. Below is the scallop crudo and the salad!
Very diverse menu with all kinds of Mediterranean dishes. Ordered pork chops, dumplings, shrimp, chicken wings. All were amazing. Really nice staff too!
If you've never had the chicken and rice here, you haven't lived. Everything else is great too.
Fantastic new place great breakfast sandwich, great burger
Great food. I really recommended

Super good. Had the burger and feel like a new person. Burger comes with kielbasa and fries with a delicious horseradish mayo. Cocktails are great too..boozy and tasty. The cherry on top was our server, Ben, who was professional yet personal and super cute. Don’t forget to try the polenta / crudo
Walked in and was able to immediately nabbed a spot at the bar. Really friendly bar staff with easy going and trendy vibe. Had the polenta with smoked white fish and poached egg. Delicious.

Beautiful and quaint aesthetic to the space and the food, which is not just nice to look at but incredibly flavorful. I'm told they started as a catering company "Little Pheasant" which is still active. Good to keep in mind.
Incredible polenta
Get the crudo
Tremendous value. Incredible food and atmosphere. Thank you Pheasant!

This spot is fire. They have an awesome brunch and we’ve heard from trusted sources that the dinner is equally awesome if not better. Recs: burger, egg & cheese sando, sunny eggs, roast chicken, sticky buns to share.
Great addition to the neighborhood.
Yum baby. The definition of Brooklyn brunch. Stoneware and ceramics to die for. Chill af staff. And most importantly: great food and drinks. Highly recommend.

The reviews aren't just hype! I went here twice within two days after my first meal.  Hip, cozy interior with unbelievably amazing food to back it up. Bring a date or a friend and make sure to try a cocktail. One of the most unusual and interesting variations of a simple vodka drink with a volumptious kick.

A fantastic new addition to the neighborhood! Dishes were beautiful, and presented amazing flavor and creativity. It is obvious that the menu was carefully and thoughtfully constructed, with attention to every detail.  menu highlights: crudo pork belly roasted octopus scallops (!!) they were amazing!  The staff is friendly, knowledgable, warm, and welcoming. I would highly recommend you stop by and pay Pheasant a visit–you won't regret it!

Hands down one of the best meals I've had in NYC.  From start to finish, the dishes presented amazing flavors.  Everything is a must try, but some of my favorites include:  The Crudo Pork Belly Caesar Salad (the croutons are out of control) Roasted Octopus (the sauce is amazing) The Scallops (the freshest I've had) Brisket (it melted in my mouth)  Their staff is extremely friendly, very helpful in curating an amazing menu, and gave us great wine recommendations.  The restaurant has a fun vibe with great music.  One of our go-to's!

Absolutely love this place! I love the design, the ambience and the food. All the dishes that we tried were delicious. I highly recommend the crudo, roasted octopus, whole grains and the hanger steak.

Perfect in every way. The ambience is spectacular and the clean Mediterranean decor transports you to a place that feels like a mix of Spain, Portugal, Italy, Norway, with a hint of Mexico(?!) all put together in an elegant way. The service is on point and the food simply delicious. Welcome to the neighborhood Pheasant.
Had a lovey dinner here, the bartenders were friendly, get the burger!!!
The best.

What a wonderful experience! I love the cocktail they have, and the environment is cozy and awesome. I would recommend the steak and pork belly, but the octopus is a little bit salty. Other than that, it’s perfect.
The best new fun dinner spot in Williamsburg! You won’t be disappointed in drinks or food!! Check it out!

Great addition to an area that needed it.  Expect solid dinner and dessert. The ceasar salad, pork belly, and chicken over rice were great. Our desserts brought an audible "mmm" from the table.  Cocktails need some improvements, but the place is brand new, so I will return and update my review.  If you want to remember how to spell dessert, just ask yourself, would you rather have 2 desserts or 2 deserts?

This place is extremely solid. I mean that in every sense of the word. Every thing was spot on and consistent. The menu is short but diverse.  There were 5 distinct cocktails. We tried all but 1 and they were all good. My favorite dish was the burger, but the Caesar salad also stood out. Desserts were great too.
Just had the best mussels dish! Awesome staff, beautiful vibes. Will definitely be back, thank you!
Incredible meal!
Life changingly good food
